It specializes in content creation, software development, UI/UX design, and localization, tailored to meet the evolving needs of the education and corporate sectors. Developed a Tornado-based metadata extractor webpage. Users upload files, extract metadata, and store it in PostgreSQL.

This backend-focused project involved building a Tornado-based Python web app that allows users to upload files and view extracted metadata. Upon upload, the app asynchronously handles files, extracts details like filename, file size, creation/modification timestamps, and character count (for text files) using the os and time modules. The data is then stored in a PostgreSQL database through the psycopg2 library. The app was fully containerized using Docker, allowing deployment on any environment. A minimal HTML interface was created for file upload testing without using external tools like Postman. RESTful endpoints were defined for both upload and metadata retrieval. This project enhanced understanding of non-blocking I/O, database integration, and DevOps tools like Docker.
Challenges in handling large files and database efficiency.
Developed a React-based hiring platform for a client. Streamlined job posting, candidate tracking, and application management.
Admin job listings, candidate progress, assessments.
React.js, Tailwind CSS, Redux, REST APIs.

Developed a modular and responsive job management system using React.js for a client to streamline recruitment processes. The platform includes three key modules: Admin Login, Job Management, and Assessment Setup. Admins can create, edit, and delete job listings, track candidate applications, and assign assessments. All job data and assessments are handled via localStorage, simulating backend functionality during the development phase. The UI was built using Tailwind CSS, ensuring mobile responsiveness and a clean, intuitive layout. Navigation was implemented with React Router, and state was managed using Redux for seamless form handling and dynamic updates. The system is designed to be backend-ready for future API integration.
Ensuring UI intuitiveness and efficient state management.

Custom VPC, 2 AZs, Public & Private Subnets, NAT Gateway, ALB, S3 Endpoint, Security Groups
ALB to EC2 in private subnets, Auto Scaling, Secure internet via NAT, Route tables for traffic flow
EC2, VPC, ALB, NAT Gateway, ASG, S3 Endpoint, IAM, Security Groups

The VPC setup involved creating a custom Virtual Private Cloud with public and private subnets distributed across two Availability Zones to ensure high availability. Public subnets hosted the Application Load Balancer (ALB) and NAT Gateways, while private subnets securely housed EC2 instances without direct internet access. The ALB routed incoming traffic to these backend instances, and outbound internet access was enabled through the NAT Gateways. An S3 Gateway Endpoint allowed private instances to access S3 without using the public internet. The setup was secured using IAM roles and Security Groups, and auto scaling ensured dynamic resource allocation based on traffic.
Initial difficulty in understanding subnets, route tables, and NAT Gateway configuration. Solved through AWS documentation and hands-on practice.
Faced issues allowing private EC2 instances to access the internet. Fixed by setting up NAT Gateway and updating route tables.
Encountered blocked traffic due to strict rules. Resolved by defining appropriate inbound/outbound rules following least privilege.
Ensuring secure, scalable infrastructure with efficient traffic flow.
Built a mentorship-driven ed-tech platform for JEE/NEET aspirants. Enabled student-mentor interaction, session booking, and resource access.
Mentor profiles, demo session booking, blogs, student dashboard.
Clean, accessible, mobile-responsive with server-side rendering.
Next.js, Tailwind CSS, React, Node.js, REST APIs

Designed and developed a full-stack mentorship platform called Career Vyas using Next.js, targeting JEE/NEET aspirants. The site enables students to explore mentor profiles, book 1-on-1 sessions, and read exam-prep blogs. Developed with a strong focus on server-side rendering for better SEO and performance. Dynamic routing was used to handle blog pages and user flows efficiently. The frontend was built with Tailwind CSS for a clean, responsive design. Backend logic, including form submissions and session data handling, was managed using Next.js API routes. In addition to development, the project involved operational setup — including recruiting mentors from IITs and AIIMS and structuring the mentorship process. Future expansion plans include adding college reviews, institutional data, and a mobile app, for which a complete Figma design has already been finalized.
Building a dynamic mentorship platform with seamless routing and user interaction.
Implemented server-side rendering and dynamic routes using Next.js. Ensured fast load times and search engine friendliness.
Faced difficulty in organizing mentor-student flow. Solved by iterating UI with real user feedback and clean layout using Tailwind CSS.
Managed multiple async API calls for sessions and blogs. Used React hooks and context for smooth data handling and UI updates.
Hands-on experience in backend and frontend development. Improved skills in database management and UI design.
